list-item.para: Wheels chocked.

ref-docs.title: Replace Cab Communication Control Panel – 09 01 01 H

hazard.hazard-desc: This inspection procedure also covers Communication Control Panels, Passenger Emergency Intercoms, loudspeakers, destination signs, and VHF radio unit.
If the inspection determines that corrective maintenance is required, report it to your supervisor to ensure that proper corrective action is taken.

step.para: Visually inspect Cab Communication Control Panel (CCCP) (1) for damage, loose mounting hardware, or stuck pushbuttons. Tighten loose hardware. If damaged, replace unit (1). Refer to BOM01312H.
Before proceeding with remaining activities, activate cab by setting train operator console controls as follows.
Master Controller keyed
Master Controller Reverser set to F (Forward) to activate cab
Master Controller Throttle switch set to 0 (Idle).

activity.title: Verify Equipment Status on Driver Display Unit

step.para: From Driver Display Unit (DDU), check that no car on train shows failures related to communications or destination signs, proceeding as follows.
From DDU Train Overview screen, click Train Process Data softkey button to display vehicle softkey group.
Click Process Data Veh. # softkey button for vehicle No. of the cab car being maintained to display Process Data Screen.
From DDU Process Data screen for current vehicle, ensure none of following fields display FAILED:

list-item.para: FDS (C Car only)
SDS1 and SDS2
IMS1 to IMS6
CCCP (C Car only)
CCP1 to CCP3
Data Car Network (DCN).

step.para: Repeat equipment status verification for each car on train.
Walk down train and ensure destination signs are as follows:

list-item.para: On all cars, Side Destination Signs SDS1 and SDS2 are displaying string “NJ TRANSIT”.
On all cars, Interior Message Signs IMS1 to IMS6 are displaying string “NJ TRANSIT”.
On C Cars, Front Destination Sign FDS is displaying string “NJT”.

hazard.hazard-desc: Some of the following steps require additional personnel on train and mobile communication equipment (walkie-talkie).

step.para: From cab, ensure NJ Transit standard coach key is not present in Master Door Control Panel MDCP1 COMMUNICATIONS key switch so that MDCP1 is not activated.
Ensure Master Controller Reverser is set to I (Isolate) to deactivate cab.
Verify Communication Control Panel CCP1 operation as follows.
Verify Public Address (PA) operation mode as follows.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn cab Communication Control Panel CCP1 rotary selector switch to position PA.

Press and hold CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near CCP1 microphone grill array. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over all train interior and exterior loudspeakers, except for A-end vestibule speakers SPK1 and SPK2.
Release CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near CCP1 microphone grill array. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is no longer heard over train loudspeakers.

Pressing and holding CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton depressed while speaking near CCP1 microphone grill array, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to position OFF. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is no longer heard over train loudspeakers.
Release CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton.
Verify Intercom (IC) operation mode as follows.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to position IC.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn rotary selector switch to position IC on another train CCP.
Press and hold CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near CCP1 microphone grill array. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is heard and clearly understood on other CCP speaker.
Release CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near CCP1 microphone grill array. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is no longer heard on other CCP.
Press and hold other CCP PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near that CCP microphone grill array. Ensure other CCP microphone audio is heard and clearly understood on CCP1.
Release other CCP PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near that CCP microphone grill array. Ensure other CCP microphone audio is no longer heard on CCP1.

Pressing and holding CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton depressed while speaking near CCP1 microphone grill array, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to any position except IC. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is no longer transmitted to other CCP.
Release CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to position OFF.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn other CCP rotary selector switch to position OFF.
Repeat CCP verification for each CCP on train.
Verify Passenger Emergency Intercom PEI operation as follows.
Momentarily press PEI1 PUSH TO CALL pushbutton and verify the following:

list-item.para: PEI1 activity LED indicator blinks (green).
CCP1 PEI ACTIVATED LED indicator blinks (green).
PEI chime is played over all train interior speakers for 2 seconds.
All train Interior Message Signs IMS1 to IMS6 display the PEI call message for 2 minutes.

step.para: Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to position PEI. Ensure CCP1 PEI ACTIVATED LED indicator is ON (green) and PEI activity LED indicator is ON (green).
Press and hold CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near CCP1 microphone grill array. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over PEI1 speaker.
Release CCP1 PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near CCP1 microphone grill array. Ensure CCP1 microphone audio is no longer heard on PEI1.
Speak near PEI1 microphone grill. Ensure PEI1 microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over CCP1 speaker.

Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to position IC or PA to place PEI call on hold. Ensure CCP1 PEI ACTIVATED LED indicator is ON (yellow) and PEI activity LED indicator is ON (yellow).
Speak near PEI1 microphone grill. Ensure PEI1 microphone audio is not heard on CCP1.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to position PEI. Ensure CCP1 PEI ACTIVATED LED indicator is ON (green) and PEI activity LED indicator is ON (green).
Speak near PEI1 microphone grill. Ensure PEI1 microphone audio is heard on CCP1.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn CCP1 rotary selector switch to position OFF to cancel PEI call. Ensure CCP1 PEI ACTIVATED LED indicator is OFF and PEI activity LED indicator is OFF.
Speak near PEI1 microphone grill. Ensure PEI1 microphone audio is not heard on CCP1.
Repeat PEI operation verification against each CCP2 and CCP3 on train.
Repeat PEI operation verification against any one CCP on train for each PEI on train. Also exercise External Push-to-call (EPTC) pushbutton associated with each PEI5 in. C Cars and S Cars.

hazard.hazard-desc: Some of the following steps require additional personnel on train and mobile communication equipment (walkie-talkie).

step.para: Ensure Master Controller Reverser is set to I (Isolate) to deactivate cab.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key in Master Door Control Panel MDCP1 COMMUNICATIONS key switch, activate MDCP1. Ensure Cab Communication Control Panel CCCP (1) and VHF Train Radio are powered up.
Press CCCP (1) pushbutton PA (3). Observe that CCCP status LED PA (3)is ON (green).

While holding CCCP pushbutton PA (3) depressed, speak near CCCP microphone grill array. Ensure that CCCP status LED PA (3) remains ON and that CCCP microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over all train interior and exterior loudspeakers, except for A-end vestibule speakers SPK1.
Release CCCP pushbutton PA (3) and speak near CCCP microphone grill array. Ensure CCCP microphone audio is no longer heard over train loudspeakers.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, turn rotary selector switch on CCP2 or CCP3 to position IC.
Press and hold activated CCP PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near microphone grill array. Ensure activated CCP microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over cab CCP1 speaker.
Release activated CCP PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and speak near CCP1 microphone grill array. Ensure CCP microphone audio is no longer heard on cab CCP1.

Press and hold CCCP (1) pushbutton IC (5) and speak near CCCP microphone grill array. Observe that CCCP status LED IC (5) is ON (green) and that CCCP microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over activated CCP speaker.

Release CCCP (1) pushbutton IC (5) and continue speaking near CCCP microphone grill array. Observe that CCCP status LED IC (5) is OFF and that CCCP microphone audio is no longer transmitted to activated CCP speaker.
Using NJ Transit standard coach key, deactivate CCP by turning rotary selector switch to position OFF.
On any PEI, momentarily press PUSH TO TALK pushbutton and verify the following:

list-item.para: Activated PEI activity LED indicator blinks (green).
CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) blinks (green).
PEI chime is played over all train interior speakers for 2 seconds.

step.para: On CCCP (1), momentarily press PEI pushbutton (4). Verify that observed PEI activity LED indicator is ON (green) and that CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) is ON (green).
Press and hold CCCP (1) PEI pushbutton (4) and speak near CCCP microphone grill array. Verify the following:

list-item.para: CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) remains ON (green).
CCCP (1) PEI LED indicator (4) is ON (green).
CCCP microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over activated PEI speaker.

step.para: Release CCCP (1) PEI pushbutton (4) and continue speaking near CCCP microphone grill array. Verify the following:

list-item.para: CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) remains ON (green).
CCCP (1) PEI LED indicator (4) is OFF.
CCCP microphone audio is no longer heard on activated PEI speaker

step.para: On activated PEI, speak near microphone grill. Verify the following:

list-item.para: CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) remains ON (green).
Activated PEI activity LED indicator is ON (green).
Activated PEI microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over cab CCP1 speaker.

step.para: On CCCP (1), momentarily press ICI pushbutton (5). Verify that activated PEI activity LED indicator is ON (yellow) and that CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) is ON (yellow).
On activated PEI, speak near microphone grill. Verify that Activated PEI microphone audio is not transmitted to cab CCP1 speaker.
On CCCP (1), momentarily press PEI pushbutton (4). Verify that activated PEI activity LED indicator is ON (green) and that CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) is ON (green).
On activated PEI, speak near microphone grill. Verify that PEI microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over cab CCP1 speaker.
On CCCP (1), momentarily press PEI CANCEL pushbutton (6). Verify that activated PEI activity LED indicator is OFF and that CCCP (1) PEI CANCEL LED indicator (6) is OFF.
On activated PEI, speak near microphone grill. Verify that activated PEI microphone audio is not transmitted to cab CCP1 speaker.

hazard.hazard-desc: The following activity requires a hand-held wayside radio.

step.para: Set hand-held wayside radio to channel 1 (161.400 MHz).
On CCCP (1), turn CHANNEL rotary selector (8) to channel 1, as seen on CHANNEL LED display (9).

Press and hold CCCP RADIO pushbutton (2) to channel 1, as seen on CHANNEL LED display (9), while speaking near CCCP microphone grill array. Verify that CCCP RADIO LED indicator (2) is ON (green) and CCCP microphone audio is heard and clearly understood over hand-held wayside radio.
Using hand-held wayside radio, transmit message over channel 1. Verify that hand-held radio message audio is heard and clearly understood over hand-held wayside radio CCCP (1) speaker.
Repeat radio operation verification for channels 2 to 10.
